FuncDef:
The fqdn command configures a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for an entity.
The undo fqdn command deletes an FQDN for an entity.
By default, no FQDN is set for an entity.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an FQDN of an entity.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters. The string does not contain question marks or spaces. The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo:
To describe an entity, run the fqdn command to configure an FQDN for the entity
The FQDN uniquely identifies an entity on a network. It consists of a host name and a domain name and can be resolved into an IP address. For example, an FQDN is set to www.user.com.
